page.title: 15LICHFIELD HOSPITALS
page.content: {St.Michael's Hospital} was originally the workhouse for paupers.It has been completely renovated over the years and is now used for the care of the elderly and the dying. There are seven wards;2 for male patients and 5 for female patients.At present there are about 115 patients with a high ratio of nursing staff to patients.St.Michael's has no casualty dept.,no childrens' ward and no operating theatre. The hospital provides a dayroom centre where elderly people can be cared for on a daily basis,while their relatives are at work. Volunteers,known as the league of friends ,raise funds to provide the patients with little extras. The oldest patient is a lady of 104. There is another hospital in Lichfield named the Victoria.
